intro: Phlox drummondii var. heynholdii, commonly known as the showy phlox, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly in the central and southern regions. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches and produces numerous stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from early summer to early fall.
